title: How to Make Foam Concrete Blocks

steps.headline: Prepare the materials.
steps.description: Ensure that you have all the correct materials. Do not worry if you do not have a cement mixer, as it can be substituted by a wheelbarrow.

steps.headline: Calculate the amount of materials you'll need.
steps.description: Decide how much foam concrete you want to make. Depending on the nature of your project, ensure you are not making too much or too little.

steps.headline: Assemble your mixer.
steps.description: If you do not have a cement mixer, you can use a power drill with an attached paint mixer to mix materials in your wheelbarrow.

steps.headline: Prepare the mixture.
steps.description: Add 5 gallons of water to your cement mixer or wheelbarrow.

steps.headline: Add the cement mix.
steps.description: For best mixing results, add the first half of your 94lb bag of concrete mix to your mixer or wheelbarrow. Mix until the cement is even throughout the whole thing and then add the last half of the bag. Once thoroughly mixed, prepare to add sand.

steps.headline: Add sand.
steps.description: Add 1 to 2 buckets of sand to your cement mixer or wheelbarrow. Sand dictates the weight and firmness of your blocks. For a lightweight result, you can use 1 bucket of sand, or for a stronger result, you can use 2 buckets of sand. Once the sand has been thoroughly mixed, prepare to add your perlite.

steps.headline: Add perlite.
steps.description: Perlite is what gives your concrete that porous texture when finished. Add one 5 gallon bucket of perlite to your mix first. Perlite will absorb the water in the mixture and thicken your mix. Depending on how thick you want your mixture, add anywhere from 5 to 25 gallons of perlite. Once you’ve reached the desired thickness, prepare to fill your block molds.

steps.headline: Fill the block molds.
steps.description: Ensure that you are doing so on a leveled surface. Pour your foam cement mixture into the molds. If the molds are small, pour the cement mix into a wheelbarrow and fill the molds with your shovel. For best drying results, cover the molds with plastic wrap.

steps.headline: Allow them to dry.
steps.description: Leave the foam concrete to dry. Foam concrete blocks take about 24 hours to dry before they are ready to be removed from the molds.

steps.headline: Remove the blocks from the molds.
steps.description: Be careful when doing so - they still need time to properly cure. Refer to your cement mix bag for expected cure times.

steps.headline: Build your desired project.
steps.description: The foam concrete bricks should be set and ready to be used for your outdoor home project.
